word: Once these young men [TWO YOUNG DOCTORS WHO HAD RECEIVED A REPROOF FROM THE LORD.] were willing to submit their wills and ideas to God's will and ways, but they became confused through your ideas of science. While you could start them on a track of investigation, you could not control their imagination. Human ideas, contracted, confused, and obscure, were to them like the bright shining of a candle at midnight. They were simply walking in the sparks of their own kindling. . . .
